medical_history.chief_complaint: Encephalitis caused by the free-living amoeba Balamuthia mandrillaris.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: In case 1, symptoms began progressively with right-side hemiparesis and speech difficulty; a focalseizure occurred in the emergency department. In case 2, the 5-year-old girl presented with generalized seizures and fever. Case 1's condition progressed, showing new lesions on MRI weeks after the initial symptoms. Case 2's fever persisted for several days, but seizures did not recur after initial presentation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Case 1: Ankylosing spondylitis, myocardial infarction, glaucoma, depression. Case 2: Not specified.
medical_history.family_history: Case 1: Tuberculosis in patient's father and brother. Case 2: Not specified.
medical_history.social_history: Case 2: Frequently travels to Mexico to visit relatives.
